concise_definition: v. 忘记, 遗忘, 忽略

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to remember or recall information, events, or people that were previously known or experienced.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能记住或回想起之前了解或经历过的信息、事件或人物。
definitions.example_en: I completely forgot her birthday last week.
definitions.example_cn: 我上周完全忘了她的生日。

definitions.explanation_en: To intentionally disregard or stop thinking about something, especially something unpleasant or burdensome.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有意忽略或不再思考某事，尤指令人不快或负担沉重的事情。
definitions.example_en: Try to forget the argument and move on.
definitions.example_cn: 试着忘掉那场争吵，继续前行。

definitions.explanation_en: To neglect or fail to attend to something due to inattention or lack of care.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因疏忽或不关心而未能留意或处理某事。
definitions.example_en: He forgot to lock the door before leaving.

comparison.analysis: “Remember” (记住) 是 “forget” 的反义词，强调主动回忆或保持记忆。而 “forget” 则是记忆的缺失或主动放弃记忆，两者在认知行为上形成直接对立。
“Overlook” (忽视) 通常指因疏忽、粗心或有意忽略而未注意到某事，常用于视觉或注意力层面，不一定涉及记忆的丧失。而 “forget” 更侧重于记忆内容的消失或无法提取，即使曾经清晰记得。
“Neglect” (疏忽) 强调因不重视或不负责任而未做应做的事，常带有道德或责任层面的批评意味。而 “forget” 更中性，可能只是记忆失效，不必然代表懒惰或失职。
